poem:
"Manifold Interpretations"

Ink, tracing inky veins through newsprint's pale lattice,
Puzzle No. 29,332, a cryptic ballad wrapped in the mundane.
Letters cocooned in squares, a mosaic of thought.
Each filled box, a repository of silent cogitations,
Striving to wear the victor's laurel.
Ear to the universe, fingers nursing the humble pen,
We scrawl, in hope of stumbled truth,
Unraveling mysteries, one blackened square at a time.
